snippet: In 2012 tournament organizers changed the color of the clay courts from red to blue, but the change lasted just one year after complaints from top players.
abstract: Rafael Nadal continues his criticism of Madrid Open's 2012 experiment with blue clay; top players complain about blue clay's slipperiness and its dissimilarity to other courts; Ion Tiriac, who owns Madrid tournament, chose blue because yellow tennis balls are easier for viewers to track on television.
lead_paragraph: In 2012 tournament organizers changed the color of the clay courts from red to blue, but the change lasted just one year after complaints from top players.

headline.main: Even Four Years Later, Bad Feelings Linger Over the Blue Clay in Madrid
headline.print_headline: Years Later, Bad Feelings Linger Over an Event’s Experiment With Clay
